response:
Acute focal brainstem signs best fit a vascular event; hemorrhage/cavernoma and demyelination are next most plausible. A PCom aneurysm can explain the III palsy but not the long-tract signs unless concurrent midbrain involvement.

differential_diagnosis = ["Right paramedian midbrain infarction (PCA perforator; Weber/Benedikt spectrum)", "Midbrain hemorrhage or cavernous malformation", "Brainstem demyelination (multiple sclerosis)", "Posterior communicating artery aneurysm causing compressive third nerve palsy", "Intrinsic midbrain tumor (glioma)"]
